Introduction:

Exploratory Data Analysis:

```{r}
ggplot(newspopularity, aes(x = rate_positive_words)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.02, fill = "green", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of the prevalence of positive words",
       x = "Prevalence of positive words",
       y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
ggplot(newspopularity, aes(x = rate_negative_words)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.02, fill = "red", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of the prevalence of negative words",
       x = "Prevalence of negative words",
       y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
ggplot(newspopularity, aes(x = title_sentiment_polarity)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.02, fill = "blue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of the polarities of the title",
       x = "Degree of polarity of the title",
       y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
ggplot(newspopularity, aes(x = n_tokens_content)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 100, fill = "purple", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of the length of article content",
       x = "Article Length",
       y = "Frequency") + 
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
ggplot(newspopularity, aes(x = n_tokens_title)) +
```
